definition: feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest

sentences.english: Maybe you can tell your friends are very excitedly discussing an event.
sentences.chinese: 你可能發現你的朋友們饒有興致地談論一個活動。

sentences.english: He muckraked his political rivals with great relish.
sentences.chinese: 他興致勃勃地揭發政敵的貪污腐化。

sentences.english: EXAMPLE: Our boss was a stern old grinch who made us work on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 我們的嚴厲老闆總是敗人興致，讓我們在假日加班。

sentences.english: And I read the tabulation of the votes with interest.
sentences.chinese: 我也饒有興致地讀了那些投票組成的那個表格。

sentences.english: A lot of people start gardens and give up when the going gets tough.
sentences.chinese: 很多人興致勃勃地開始種菜，但出現困難後就放棄了。

sentences.english: Employees in high spirits, and actively enthusiastic, each one not to be outdone.
sentences.chinese: 員工們興致勃勃，積極踊躍，每一個都不甘示弱。

sentences.english: People jubilantly took part in the festival celebrations in the parks.
sentences.chinese: 人們興致勃勃地參加遊園活動。

sentences.english: Some things are fun the first time you do them------ and then not so much the next.
sentences.chinese: 有些事情第一次做興致昂然，之後再做就索然無味了。

sentences.english: I can also teach you how to cook some Chinese food if you have the interest.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有興致，我還可以教你如何親手做中國菜呢。

sentences.english: He invited the woodcutter aboard the boat. He happily played the guqin for him.
sentences.chinese: 他立即請樵夫上船，興致勃勃地爲他演奏。

sentences.english: Toward the Qin Shi, the number of people who proudly interest, flocked to forget.
sentences.chinese: 向着石琴，多少人興致昂然，絡繹不絕，流連忘返。

sentences.english: There were three professors at the railway station.They were deep in conversation.
sentences.chinese: 三位教授在火車站一邊等車，一邊興致勃勃地聊着。

sentences.english: If you’re so inclined, pick up a new sport. Learn to play racquetball.
sentences.chinese: 要是你很有興致，可以學習一項新的運動。

sentences.english: When the return path, not to interest at the time of flying.
sentences.chinese: 歸時的路上，不見來時的興致翩翩。

sentences.english: Please pay a visit to sights of Suzhou if you are interested in them.
sentences.chinese: 假如有興致，請到蘇州的旅遊景點參觀。

sentences.english: He really put a dampener on my day.
sentences.chinese: 我一整天的興致都讓他給破壞了。

definition: to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
